title: In pictures: the world's best steak restaurants
text:
Previous slide Next slide 1 of 13 View All Skip Ad 
Caprice, Hong Kong, China 
This two Michelin star French restaurant located in the Four Seasons overlooks stunning Victoria Harbour and the Kowloon Peninsula. Fabrice Vulin, the head chef, has been named as on of a select few chefs entrusted with the world's most expensive beef , Alexandre Polmard's 2000 vintage c√¥te de boeuf. The renouned steak is hibernated for 15 years and blasted with cold air at 75 miles per hour, apparently resulting in an exquisite taste and such a tender texture that you won't even need a knife to cut it. You should start saving up though as a slice at Caprice will set you back $700.
